titleStmt.title: C. T. Schable et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2927

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky:
WE the undersigned, citizens of Harrison County, protest against the Governor of the State calling a Convention, for the following reasons:

First: Because the Legislature is alone authorized by the Constitution to call a Convention, and the Governor has no power to do so; that a Convention which would be called by him would be illegal, revolutionary, and the principle if acquiesced in, will inevitably lead to anarchy and the destruction of Constitutional Liberty.
Second: It will unnecessarly lead to additional taxation.

C. T. Schable.
Frank Box
M, Bliss
. G. Frazer
W. C. Hobson
W. L. Bents
Robert Atkins
Kedered Robilzer
A. Hammer
C. T. Wilson
T, Geier
Jos M Woods
Richard King
Wm Snodgrass
Jno Northcutt
Joseph Cosby
G. W. Coon
Jon Rohr
John Coons
Jas T Mussleman
